definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized

pinyin: ren2 min2 min2 zhu3 zhuan1 zheng4

sentences.english: "No to corruption," they say. "No to dictatorship."
sentences.chinese: 示威者提出“不要貪污，不要專政”。

sentences.english: What they really want is a one-party fascist dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 他們實際上要的是法西斯主義的一黨專政。

sentences.english: Here is proof of the superiority of our people's democratic dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 這也證明我們人民民主專政的優越性。

sentences.english: Second, Mr McCain should hammer away at the dangers of single-party rule in Washington, DC.
sentences.chinese: 第二，麥凱恩應該不斷強調華盛頓一黨專政的危害。

sentences.english: We must stand up for the Four Cardinal Principles and especially the people's democratic dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 四項基本原則必須講，人民民主專政必須講。

sentences.english: Our army is the mainstay of the dictatorship of the proletariat in China.
sentences.chinese: 我們的軍隊是無產階級專政的柱石。

sentences.english: Some will be incompatible with others, for example, "Freedom" and "Tyranny.
sentences.chinese: 有些風格之間將水火不容，例如“自由”和“專政”。

sentences.english: They display the sheep's head of constitutional government while selling the dog-meat of one-party dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 他們是在掛憲政的羊頭，賣一黨專政的狗肉。

sentences.english: Dumas kept the Republican political views, against the monarchy.
sentences.chinese: 大仲馬信守共和政見，反對君主專政。

sentences.english: A one-party state can be the start of the slippery slopetowards fascism.
sentences.chinese: 一黨專政有可能是滑向法西斯主義的起點。

sentences.english: People's democratic dictatorship needs the leadership of the working class.
sentences.chinese: 人民民主專政需要工人階級的領導。

sentences.english: China applies the people's democratic dictatorship system.
sentences.chinese: 我國實行的是人民民主專政制度。

sentences.english: The people's democratic dictatorship has been consolidated.
sentences.chinese: 人民民主專政業已鞏固。

sentences.english: In reality, it is a party dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 在現實中，它是一個黨專政。

sentences.english: Can we refrain from exercising the people's democratic dictatorship?
sentences.chinese: 人民民主專政能不用嗎？

sentences.english: In fact, two Zhangs had neither formed strong political force nor exercised dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 其實，二張並沒有形成強大的政治勢力，更沒有專政。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
